IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: ESTABLISH AND CARRYOUT ENRICHMENT ACTIVITIES THAT SUPPORT THE MISSION OF MERCER COUNTY COMMUNITY COLLEGE AND THE COMMUNITY IT SERVES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: ESTABLISH AND CARRYOUT ENRICHMENT ACTIVITIES THAT SUPPORT THE MISSION OF MERCER COUNTY COMMUNITY COLLEGE AND THE COMMUNITY IT SERVES.
IRS990.Desc: THE FOUNDATION PROVIDES SUPPORT FOR MERCER COUNTY COMMUNITY COLLEGE'S VARIOUS PROGRAMS (SCHOLARSHIPS, COLLEGE SPORTS, EDUCATIONAL) FOR ITS STUDENTS, FACULTY AND SURROUNDING COMMUNITY INCLUDING WWFM, THE CLASSICAL NETWORK AND KELSEY THEATRE AND THE VARIOUS SUPPORTING COSTS ASSOCIATED WITH THE PROGRAMS.

BusinessName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: MARK BANYACSKI ACTING VICE PRESIDENT FOR FINANCE & ADMINISTRATION

Form990ScheduleAPartVIGrp.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE A, PART II, LINE 10, EXPLANATION OF OTHER INCOME:

OtherLiabilitiesOrgGrp.Desc: DUE TO MERCER COUNTY COMMUNITY COLLEGE

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: U.S. GAAP REQUIRES MANAGEMENT TO EVALUATE TAX POSITIONS TAKEN BY THE FOUNDATION AND RECOGNIZE A TAX LIABILITY IF THE FOUNDATION HAS TAKEN AN UNCERTAIN POSITION THAT MORE LIKELY THAN NOT WOULD NOT BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES. MANAGEMENT EVALUATED THE FOUNDATION'S TAX POSITIONS AND CONCLUDED THAT THE FOUNDATION HAD TAKEN NO UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS THAT REQUIRE ADJUSTMENT TO THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS TO COMPLY WITH THE PROVISIONS OF THIS GUIDANCE.

THE FOUNDATION'S ENDOWMENT FUNDS CONSIST OF APPROXIMATELY 4 INDIVIDUAL FUNDS ESTABLISHED FOR A VARIETY OF PURPOSES. THE ENDOWMENT FUNDS INCLUDE BOTH DONOR-RESTRICTED ENDOWMENT FUNDS AND FUNDS DESIGNATED BY THE FOUNDATION'S BOARD OF DIRECTORS TO FUNCTION AS ENDOWMENTS.

RecipientTable.NonCashAssistanceDesc: SPRINTER AMBULANCE&EQUIPMENT ($13,000)1996 KAWAII GRAND PIANO GE-2 ($10,000)

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: SCHOLARSHIP GRANTS ARE AWARDED, THE COLLEGE CREDITS THE AWARDED AMOUNT TO THE STUDENT'S ACCOUNT, THE ACCOUNT STATEMENT IS THEN SUBMITTED TO THE FOUNDATION AND THE FOUNDATION PAYS THE AWARD TO THE COLLEGE.
PRESIDENT HAS A WRITTEN EMPLOYMENT CONTRACT, WHICH INCLUDES BOTH COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS, THAT IS APPROVED BY THE COLLEGE BOARD OF TRUSTEES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE BOARD REVIEWS THE FORM 990 PRIOR TO FILING.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FOUNDATION FOLLOWS THE WRITTEN CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY INSTITUTED BY MERCER COUNTY COMMUNITY COLLEGE. THE FOUNDATION REVIEWS ANY POTENTIAL CONFLICTS ANNUALLY AT THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS MEETING. FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15: THERE WAS NO COMPENSATION PAID BY THE ORGANIZATION. ALL EMPLOYEES ARE EMPLOYEES OF THE COLLEGE AND COMPENSATED BY THE COLLEGE. CERTAIN DIRECT COSTS RELATED TO SALARIES ARE CHARGED TO THE FOUNDATION FROM THE COLLEGE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 18
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: FORM 990 IS AVAILABLE ON THE WEBSITE AT HTTP://WWW.MCCC.EDU/FOUNDATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ALL GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, THE CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY AND ALL FINANCIAL STATEMENTS OF THE FOUNDATION ARE AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST AND THE WEBSITE HTTP://WWW.MCCC.EDU/FOUNDATION.
